fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Unlicensed authenticated users are not able to access Confluence when any space is enabled in JSM.
 *Prerequisites*
 * Enable Anonymous access under Global Permissions.
 * Create a test user with Jira only access ( unlicensed for confluence)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two spaces A and B with anonymous “VIEW” only access  
 # Link space A to a JSM project. This will enable “unlicensed access” under Global permissions 
 #  Access any unrestricted page from space B with the test user’s account.
  

h3. Expected Results
 * User should be able to see that page because anonymous access is enabled and this feature is implemented as per [CLSUP-3369|https://hello.atlassian.net/browse/CLSUP-3369?src=confmacro]

h3. Actual Results
 * The user is not able to see that page and an error is thrown: You have stumbled on a restricted space.

h3. Workaround
 * (& understanding) 

As both JSM enabled spaces and this FR provides unlicensed access to confluence so 
 Both are not working at the same time. 
 If we disable “Unlicensed access” under global permissions. This will disable access for spaces that are enabled through JSM and then this Functionality is working fine and the user will be able to see that page.
fields.summary: Unlicensed authenticated users are not able to access Confluence when any space is enabled in JSM(CLSUP-3369)

{quote}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Restored pages are missing from CQL index

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Page A. The page can be found through /rest/api/search?cql=id=<page id> (correct behaviour)
# Delete Page A. The page cannot be found through /rest/api/search?cql=id=<page id> (correct behaviour)
# Restore Page A from the trash. The page cannot be found through /rest/api/search?cql=id=<page id> (wrong behaviour)
# Save a new revision of page A. The page can be found through /rest/api/search?cql=id=<page id> (correct behaviour)

h3. Expected Results

The page can be found through search.

h3. Actual Results

The page cannot be found through search.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Restored pages are missing from CQL index

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The *Files & Images* *on the new editor* is no longer allowing users to select different ways of uploading a file, or letting them chose files that were previously added to Confluence. As soon as the user clicks on the icon (or insert a /files macro) a pop-up appears prompting the user to upload a file directly from their machine, not providing any other options.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access/Create a page and click on *Files & Images* icon (or Type /files)

h3. Expected Results
* User should be able to choose from other files embedded into the page, select other options to upload files and choose to upload files from their machine.

h3. Actual Results
* As soon as you click the *Files* icon, a pop-up appears immediately prompting you to select a file from your local machine, not allowing you to select any other options. I recorded a quick GIF of this behavior in action:

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Files & images functionality is now only allowing users to upload files from their machine, and no other option

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Using the [Microsoft OneDrive for Business|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1221882/microsoft-onedrive-for-business] add-on, when attaching an Excel file, the default worksheet will show.
It's not possible to link to a specific worksheet in Excel documents with multiple worksheets.

It is also not possible to do this using the Confluence Microsoft Office Excel macro.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow for linking to specific worksheets (tabs) in Excel.
 
h3. Workaround 
There is no known workaround for linking within Confluence.
fields.summary: Support for linking specific worksheet in Excel documents with multiple tabs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Pasted bodiless dynamic content macros fail to render in edit mode.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install an app providing a macro that declares the bodyType as none. For a minimal example, use [https://dx-inline-macro.glitch.me|https://dx-inline-macro.glitch.me/]. 
 # Add the macro to a page between the words "foo" and "bar".
 # Select the editor content from "foo" to "bar" inclusive and copy it into the copy buffer.
 # Move the cursor to a new location in the editor and paste the content from the copy buffer.
 # Observe the rendered output corresponding the pasted content.

h3. Expected Results

The rendered content is identical to what was copied.
h3. Actual Results

The rendered content is "foo" followed by white space followed by "bar".
h3. Workaround

None

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some Confluence REST APIs allow web resources to be returned to help with the rendering of content. This is done by specify an expand parameter when making the API call. Example APIs allowing this include:
 * [POST /wiki/rest/api/contentbody/convert/|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content-body/#api-api-contentbody-convert-to-post]
 * [GET /wiki/rest/api/search|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-search/#api-api-search-get]

Note that the underlying issue could be identical to that of CONFCLOUD-71603.

Also see [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/show-macros-within-dynamic-macros/45476] for further context.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Call a REST API that supports the returning of web resources by adding an expand query parameter as follows: [api-path]?expand=webresource.superbatch.metatags,webresource.tags.all. This call may be from the app server using JWT authentication or from an app iframe via AP.request.
 # Observe the content of the field `webresource.tags.all` returned in the response.

h3. Expected Results

The content of the field `webresource.tags.all` includes all CSS and JS resources necessary to render content providing experiences identical to Confluence.
h3. Actual Results

The content of the field `webresource.tags.all` only includes a colors.css resource.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Confluence REST API not returning web resources

fields.description:
h3. Current Scenario
Confluence is structured in a way that there are pages and child-pages and iles are attached to those pages.

h3. Desired Scenario
Confluence should provide an alternative to this structure, in this case, a folder-like solution, enabling users to have a similar experience to what they have on their Operation System as well as other services (like Sharepoint)
fields.summary: Allow admins to create folder structure instead of page hierarchy

fields.description:
I need to aggregate comments from different Confluence pages so that I can see all comments in one place.
 * I would like to be able to filter out Comments that are resolved comments
 * It would be really nice if I could aggregate comments based on a keyword, such as "OPEN ITEM"

My use case is that we're working on a project that has a heavy documentation component to it, and our team members are making suggestions on various pages. Some of the comments are being resolved now, others will need to be considered later. We want a programmatic way of getting those comments (rather than having to copy and paste them into a separate Confluence page).
fields.summary: Ability to aggregate comments from different pages into one page

fields.description:
h3. Current Scenario
Admins are able to set [Ip Allow List|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/specify-ip-addresses-for-product-access/] for their instances, however, once added these IPs are able to access any public space on the instance.

h3. Desired Scenario
Admins should be able to set Allow Lists per Space, instead of per instance: this would allow finer control over which IPs are able to view certain spaces. This would be great for content compartmentalization, as companies can handle multiple clients that should only be able to view certain data.
fields.summary: Allow List for spaces

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Confluence can be configured to allow anonymous access, however, the conversion of content links to the smart link format does not work when accessing anonymously.

For context, see [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/smart-link-object-resolver-issues/45369].
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a space to allow anonymous access as per [https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/set-up-public-access/].
 # In an anonymous browser session, create Page A.
 # In an anonymous browser session, create Page B.
 # In an anonymous browser session, edit Page A, insert a link to Page B and save it.
 # In an anonymous browser session, observe Page A in view mode.
 # In a logged in browser session, observe Page A in view mode.
 # In a logged in browser session, edit Page A, re-paste the link to Page B and save it.
 # In a logged in browser session, observe Page A in view mode.
 # In an anonymous browser session, observe Page A in view mode.

h3. Expected Results

At steps 5, 6, 7, 8 and 9, the link to Page B is rendered as a smart link.
h3. Actual Results

At steps 5, 6 and 9, the link to Page B is not rendered as a smart link. At steps 7 and 8, the link to Page B is rendered as a smart link. It is suspected that the smart link rendering of the link to Page B at step 8 is due to caching which is why the results conflict with those of step 5.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Confluence page smart links do not support anonymous access

fields.description:

h3. Expected Results
It shouldn't trigger the onboarding modals to watch pages

h3. Actual Results
It triggers the onboarding modals for every page we access:
 [^anonymous_watch.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Welcome to Confluence onboarding is shown on every page for anonymous users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
By default, Confluence's search only returns results for pages, blog posts, people, files/attachments or spaces. It would be useful if it also returned results containing custom contents, such as questions and answers, calendars and others.

h3. Suggested Solution
Include custom contents by default on search results


h3. Workaround
Manually select the custom type on the advanced search, under the *Type* filter.
fields.summary: Allow Confluence Search to return results for custom contents by default

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After importing a space exported from Confluence Cloud into Confluence Server, the structure of the pages with images and text gets broken.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a fresh Space on the Confluence Cloud
 # Create a new page and put simple text and images in it. (You can use the following storage format for creating this simple page: [^page_structure_test.txt] )
 # Export this space from Confluence Cloud. (Sample exported space from Confluence Cloud: [^confluence-cloud-TESTSPACE1-export.zip] )
 # Import it to a Confluence Server instance. (I used Confluence 7.9.1 to reproduce this issue.)

h3. Expected Results

The page should be structured and displayed the same on the Confluence Server as it is structured and displayed on the Confluence Cloud.

!cloud_page.jpg|width=130,height=163!
h3. Actual Results

The structure is broken:
 !server_page.jpg|width=472,height=200!
h3. Workaround

The page needs a manual edit to fix its structure.
fields.summary: Importing a space exported from Confluence Cloud into Confluence Server breaks page structure

fields.description:

When editing the *Spaces list* macro, clicking on the *Category* tab will throw a "We’ve hit a snag" error.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On  page using the legacy editor, if you copy and paste a few page links from other spaces and publish, if a user viewing this page don't have permissions on the space where the page link came from, they won't be able to see the page title and instead, will be presented with a /wiki/spaces/<spacekey>/pages/<pageID>.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page using the legacy editor
 # Insert a Page Link from another space
 # Publish the page
 # Make sure to have no space permissions on the space where the page link was from
# Refresh the published page 


h3. Expected Results
The page title doesn't change

h3. Actual Results
The page title only is shown up to users who have access from the space the URL is from.
If the user has no space permissions on the space where the URL is, the title is also not shown, only the pattern /wiki/spaces/<spacekey>/pages/<pageID> appears instead.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page links on legacy editor pages does not show the title if the user has no space permissions for page linked

Currently, when a new user being given Administrator or site-admin permission the user won't have Admin permission to existing space unless the the spaces has the group where the user being added.

The admin need to manually go to all the spaces and recover permission.
fields.summary: Admin permission inherit to all space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is possible to embed images within multicolumn tables in a Confluence page. When this is done, the image width information returned by /wiki/rest/api/content/\{id}?expand=body.atlas_doc_format returns width information relative to the page, not table column.

To resolve this, an additional width relative to the parent container should be returned.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a confluence page
 # Add a table and add an image in the table
 # Resize the image
 # Call /wiki/rest/api/content/\{id}?expand=body.atlas_doc_format

h3. Expected Results

The image width given in the atlas_doc_format is relative to the current container (table cell) or to the image itself.
h3. Actual Results

The image width given is relative to the page width.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Misleading image width returned by content API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Embedding a macro within a rich text macro's body causes AP.confluence.getMacroBody() not to invokes the callback passes to it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Visit any Confluence page and start editing it.
 # Insert Macro A where it is defined as per the specifications below.
 # Insert another macro such as the Jira macro within the body of Macro A and enter a search such as "assignee = currentUser()" then save it.
 # Click on Macro A, open its editor and observe the rendered macro body data.
 # Open the browser's dev tools and enter AP.confluence.getMacroData(console.log).

Macro A specifications:
 * Important descriptor aspects: \{"bodyType": "rich-text", "outputType": "block", editor: customEditorUrl}

 * The macro's custom editor calls AP.confluence.getMacroBody() during initialisation and renders the result.

 * This macro is implemented by the app at [https://speckle-verbena-cart.glitch.me/]. The macro's name is "Rich Text Macro" and the app's descriptor URL is [https://speckle-verbena-cart.glitch.me/connect.json].

h3. Expected Results

At step 5, the console.log() function is called with the macro data.
h3. Actual Results

At step 5, the console.log() function is not called with the macro data.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Rich text macro data is not retrievable when another macro is embedded

fields.description:

The landing page setting should be moved to a more obvious place on the page – in the main settings column. fields.description:

h3. Suggested Solution

fields.summary: Option to disable linkable headings

fields.description:

h3. Suggested Solution

fields.summary: Allow public links feature to ignore the IP allowlist

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When exporting a page to PDF, while it is possible 'export' the page, when you attempt to click to download it, it returns an error 403, refusing to authorize the download.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page in Confluence
 # Make sure to have no administrator groups for the user or space admin permissions
 # Go to the three dots button on the page menu and click export to PDF
 # On the screen to export PDF, click on download


h3. Expected Results
The PDF would download as expected .

h3. Actual Results
If you are not part of administrators, site-admins user or a space administrator, the PDF won't be downloaded and you will get a 403 error instead.


h3. Workaround
Export the page to Word instead.
fields.summary: Downloading a page from Export to PDF is returning 403 error for non administrators users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the Copy Single Page API to copy a page that containing a Giphy attachment to the original source of the copy, the API fails due to an attachment size mismatch.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page.
 # Use "/" menu to insert a Giphy image to the page.
 # Publish the page.
 # Go to Attachments using a page meatballs menu. Note the attached gif size.
 # Go back to the page, click on the embedded gif. Note the size of the gif file displayed in attachment view overlay.
 # If sizes from steps 4 and 5 do *NOT* match, go to the step 7, otherwise remove the attachment and go to the step 2.
 # Use Copy Single Page API or Copy Page Hierarchy REST API to copy the page. Make sure to set {color:#00875a}{{copyAttachments}}{color} flag to {color:#0747a6}{{true}}{color}.
 # Use the Copy Single Page API to Copy the copied page back to its original source.

h3. Expected Results

200 response from the API and the page copied in Confluence.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown:
{noformat}
2021-02-16T12:13:09.150Z	5dd7c953-d5da-5164-a900-91f66cdb8ba8	ERROR	{
  message: 'com.atlassian.confluence.pages.attachments.AttachmentDataStreamSizeMismatchException: Attachment data stream contains a different number of bytes to the declared size of the attachment. Expected: 501403, actual: 2719586',
  status: 500
}
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Use rest api to copy a single page containing a giphy attachment to the original source of the copy fails due to an attachment size mismatch

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The [copy page API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content---children-and-descendants/#api-api-content-id-copy-post] allows for parameters controlling whether certain aspects of the page are copied. These aspects include labels and properties. The copy semantics of these aspects are inconsistent since labels seems to have synchronization semantics, but properties seem to have additive semantics.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1223854/property-inspector-for-confluence.
 # Create Page A
 # Create Page B
 # Add label "foo" to Page B.
 # Use the Property Inspector app to add a content property with key of "foo" and value of "bar" to Page B.
 # Create an app that calls the copy single page API (/wiki/rest/api/content/\{id}/copy) specifying:
 ## source content ID to be Page A
 ## destination content ID to be Page B
 ## copyProperties: true
 ## copyLabels: true
 # Install the app.
 # Trigger the app to call the API.
 # Reload Page B.
 # Observe the labels in Page B.
 # Use the Property Inspector app to observe the properties in Page B.

h3. Expected Results

At steps 10 and 11, the label "foo" and property "foo" either both exist or both don't exist.
h3. Actual Results

At step 10, the label "foo" no longer appears (synchronization semantics).

At step 11, the property "foo" still exists (additive semantics).
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Inconsistent semantics in copy single page API
Webitems don't work when in the system.user/user-content location and targeting a dialog

h3. Issue Summary

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page;
 # Add a header 1 and type some text there;
 # Add a header 2 and also type some text there;
 # Add a header 3 and again type text there;
 # Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results

The WYSIWYG works, and the same way we see the content in the editing mode is the way we see it on the published page:

!image-2021-02-16-16-06-52-061.png!
h3. Actual Results

Instead of letting the headers separated by the same white space we have in the editing mode, it lets the headers one below the other:

!image-2021-02-16-16-06-27-628.png!
h3. Workaround

After each header, add a line break with the enter key to have the same experience as the editing mode.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the CQL search API and expanding web resources, inconsistent webresource contents are returned.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Page 1 and add an /info macro to it.
 # Create Page 2, but leave it empty.
 # Search with {{/rest/api/search?cql=title="Page%201"&expand=content.body.export_view.webresource.tags.css,content.body.export_view.webresource.uris.css}} and observe the results.
 # Search with {{/rest/api/search?cql=title="Page%202"&expand=content.body.export_view.webresource.tags.css,content.body.export_view.webresource.uris.css}} and observe the results.
 # Search with {{/rest/api/search?cql=title%20IN%20("Page%201","Page%202")&expand=content.body.export_view.webresource.tags.css,content.body.export_view.webresource.uris.css}} and observe the results.
 # Remove the /info macro from Page 1.
 # Add an /info macro to Page 2.
 # Search with {{/rest/api/search?cql=}}{{title%20IN%20("Page%201","Page%202")}}{{&expand=content.body.export_view.webresource.tags.css,content.body.export_view.webresource.uris.css}} and observe the results.

h3. Expected Results

The contents of the webresource section matches the resources required by the pages in the search results.
h3. Actual Results
 * When fetching multiple pages at once through the REST API, the {{webresource}} expansion of all the returned pages is set to the one of whichever page is the first result, even if the pages require different web resources.
 * The “colors” stylesheet is not listed in the “webresource.uris” expansion.
 * The “webresource.uris.css” expansion does not work if it contains an empty list.

h3. Workaround

Difficult (visit link below).

See [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/weird-behaviour-of-body-webresource-expansions/44523.]
fields.summary: Inconsistent webresources returned in CQL search results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If we set some smart links as headers, they won't be correctly displayed in the table of contents if they're at the bottom of the page or at least not visible when the page loads.

This is because the TOC will be generated before the smart link gets processed, which means the link's URL will be listed, instead of the link's contents.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page and insert a Table Of Contents macro at the top
# Insert any smart link (a link to another page or a Jira issue) below the TOC macro
# Fill the page with text so it will have a scrollbar 
# At the bottom, below the text, insert another smart link
# Publish the page and reload it

h3. Expected Results
All smart links should be rendered correctly on the TOC macro

h3. Actual Results
Only the visible links will be correctly listed, the others will be listed as the URL:
 !image-2021-02-11-20-03-02-753.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: TOC won't render smart links correctly if they're below visible area

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Public Links feature is a great way for users to share pages with people outside their organization. It creates a special URL that directs to a safe, view-only version of an individual Confluence page.

*Issue:* When clicking on *Copy link* to get the URL of the public link, the first link that is generated is wrong. It creates a link to a page inside the instance, so it asks the users to log-in in order to see the page (which is not expected). The URL starts like this:
{code:java}
https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SPACE_KEY/pages/PAGE_ID
{code}
When clicking on *Copy link* again, it generates the correct URL:
{code:java}
https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/external/PAGE_ID
{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce

(!) In order to reproduce this bug, you need to have Public Links enabled in your instance.
 # Create a page.
 # Click on *share* and turn on Public Link for this page.
 # Copy the public link.
 # Try to open it using the Incognito window, and Confluence will ask you to log in.
 # Copy the public link *again* and open it in the Incognito window (Now you will see the content of the page)


h3. Expected Results

The first link generated should be the correct public link. The person should be able to see the content of the page.
h3. Actual Results

The first link generated takes you to a page inside the instance, forcing the user to log in to see the content.

*Note*
* As a variation of this bug, sometimes the already generated links stop working for a moment, and then get to work again without any action taken.

h3. Workaround


Click on *Copy Link* twice and check if the link that was created has */external*
fields.summary: Generated Public Link forces external users to log in to see the page

 !Screen Shot 2021-02-11 at 09.02.43.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

A possible alternative, in this case, would be adding the Asana link a regular link by either typing */link* or command+K, pasting the link to Asana, and populating the name field.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing a page that has undefined page links, the editor will sometimes cause the links to become malformed causing them to no longer function on the page when published.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
h4. Note: this behavior is intermittent and may be possible to reproduce in some scenarios, but will be more difficult in some than others.

- Create a new page and use the "how-to" template (the how-to template produces the most consistent results.)
- create a undefined page link anywhere on the page.
- Once the page is created and published, edit the page again immediately.
- You may or may not end up with a broken link.

h3. Expected Results
- You always get a working link

h3. Actual Results

 [^Undefined Page Links Break.mov] 
The editor will try to interpret the undefined link, and will evetntually produce a "null" after the ".net" portion of the URL. The following javascript error will be present:
{code}
APIError: URL not supported
    at p.fetchData (https://confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/10795.PHZ48FYX71.js:169:3404)
{code}

h3. Workaround

Available workarounds are:
- recreate the undefined page link by hand
- revert the page to a previous version
- reload the editor before publishing can sometimes result in the link loading properly.
fields.summary: Editing A Page with undefined links Can break the undefined links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* Files that were uploaded to a page in Confluence do not have their name changed in the published version of a page after the user changes the name of the file by going to the attachments section of a page (*...* > Attachments)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and attach a file to it (e.g. this Word document here:  [^Test Doc to Troubleshoot Atlassian Issue.docx] );
 # Publish the page and go to the Attachments section (*...* > Attachments);
# Here you'll see the attached file, and on the right-hand side click on *Properties*
 !Screen Shot 2021-02-09 at 17.26.10.png|thumbnail! 
# Rename the file to something else > Save > go back to the page;
# Check the file name and hove the mouse over it.


h3. Expected Results
* The file name change to be reflected on the published version of the page

h3. Actual Results
* The file name is not changed on the published version of the page, although by accessing the *Attachments* section of the page we can see that the name of the file has indeed changed.
 !Screen Shot 2021-02-09 at 17.22.25.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2021-02-09 at 17.23.19.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2021-02-09 at 17.23.33.png|thumbnail! 

(I inserted an attachment macro so we can see the discrepancy between the names)


h3. Workaround
Although not ideal the solution would be renaming the file before uploading/reuploading it to Confluence.
fields.summary: Files do not have their name changed in the published version of a page

fields.description:
In the event that legal discovery is requested against Confluence Cloud instances, The search  is not reliable enough to extract documents that pertain to the legal discovery, and does not provide a bulk export of the search results documents.

To resolve this I would like to recommend two things:
1. Provide a more comprehensive set of advanced search options that will allow for exact string matches in search (regardless of search time)
2. Provide bulk export of search results Documents in full with an option to include document versions.
fields.summary: Provide Better Search and Export in Confluence for Legal Discovery

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
A lot of the Confluence default emojis, when inserted in the Default Space Content template, are being changed by the :blue_star: one.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As a Confluence administrator, go to *Settings > Global Templates and Blueprints*;
# Go down in this screen and edit the *Default Space Template*;
# Anywhere on the page, insert the emoji :wave:, for example;
# Save the template;
# On the top bar, go to *Spaces > View All Spaces > Create Space*;
# Choose the blank space template and create it.

h3. Expected Results
The space overview page shows the :wave: emoji.

h3. Actual Results
Instead of the emoji we inserted, it shows the :blue_start: one.

*Notes*
* Linked to this bug, you can find some other bugs we have that are also related to this :blue_star: emoji taking the place of the other emojis.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Emojis added to the Default Space Content template are changed for a blue star

Space import did not not import all the blog from source site.

# Export the space which contain the blog
# Import it to another site

h3. Expected Results

All blog should be imported.

h3. Actual Results

Only a few of the blog get imported.

h3. Workaround

# Create a new space on the source side
# Move all the missing blog to the new space
# Export the new space and import it to the target site
# Once the space is imported, moved the blogs to the target space.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A page using the Legacy editor will display the Default font of the browser while in Edit mode.
 The default browser font is normally set to Times New Roman For most browsers (Chrome, Brave, Firefox)

This seems to be because the @font-family CSS Definition is not being sent or applied?
 - [https://developers.google.com/web/tools/chrome-devtools/css/reference]

 - [https://github.com/necolas/normalize.css/issues/665]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page using the Legacy editor

h3. Expected Results

Page should use the default system-ui font
{code:java}
system-ui
{code}
For Chrome, this would be: BlinkMacSystemFont (system-ui)
h3. Actual Results

Edit mode:

!Screenshot 2021-02-08 at 10.50.47.png|width=2021,height=385!

Published:

!Screenshot 2021-02-08 at 10.53.51.png|width=2036,height=458!

 
 *Notes*

Chrome Extention *WhatFont* can be used to detect what font is displayed on a page.

1. *WhatFont* extension is unable to detect a font in the screenshot provided under *Edit Mode* and so the Default Browser Font is used (Times New Roman).

2. The screenshot provided under *Published* displays "System-UI" on the text this is what the Extention *WhatFont* is able to detect as the font. Which corresponds with the CSS Font Definitions for the page.


Also, likely related to this https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-9708
  
h3. Workaround

Converting the page to the New editor seems to correct this.
fields.summary: Legacy editor Pages Displaying in Default Browser FONT

fields.description:
On the [Import content into Confluence Cloud documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/import-content-into-confluence-cloud/], it is sharing instructions to import word documents, but, these are no longer matching with the current UI/options to do so.

Specifically, hovering the cursor over *Advanced details* and then, select the option to import the Word document.
h3. Suggestion

To have the article matching with the current UI, this is a suggestion to update the steps to import a word document. For example:
{quote} # View an existing page. The page chosen becomes the parent page of the document imported.
 # From the top right of the page, choose  •••, hover the cursor over *Advanced details* and select *Import word document*
 # Choose *Select file to import*, locate the Word document you want to import, then choose *Import*. The  take you onto the Import configuration step.
 # Choose the import options you want (see below for more info), and then *Import*. {quote}
(i) Alternatively, the instructions to import a word document while creating a page could also help. For example:
 # Tap the *Create* button at the navigation bar.
 # From the draft, under the template navigator, select *Import*
 # Select *Word document*
!import_beta.png|thumbnail!
 # Select the file to upload
fields.summary: Update the documentation to import content

fields.description:
h3. Current Scenario
Users are unable to add inline comments on text within tables. This is a limitation on the new editor that prevents adding inline comments on macros (including tables), emojis, and mentions.

Users are unable to add inline comments as they see a greyed out box, and an error message, similar to this next screenshot:

 !Screen Shot 2021-02-04 at 12.29.40.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Desired Scenario
As tables are an integral part of communicating clear messages to teams and users it would be great if we could have the inline comment functionality supported on the new editor, as it would provide users with the ability to add their thoughts onto text inside tables.
fields.summary: Inline Comment Tables

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

'Live Search', 'Recently Updated' and ''Recently Updated Dashboard' Macro doesn't work well if the site name starts with 'wiki'.the `wiki` namespace at the front of the base-URL of the tenant is throwing off the parsing on the live macro search result, hence it's only removing the first part and leaving the remaining link, and when we append the base-URL plus wiki context it doubles up as you can see from the current state.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a site with a name starting with 'wiki', let say, 'wiki123.atlassian.net'.
 # Create a page with a live search macro in it.
 # Create another page that you will search using the live search macro, let say 'TEST'.
 # Search the page TEST in the live search macro. And click on the result that shows up.
 # The resultant page will not open and will show a 404 error because the URL that opens up is wrong.

h3. Notes:
 * The wrong URL consists of two times the base URL: wiki123.atlassian.net/*wiki123.atlassian.net*/wiki/space/SPACEKEY/page/TEST

 * If we inspect, the URL ideally have the link starting from space/SPACEKEY/page/TEST but the system gets confused and pulls the link that is after the initial base-URL 'wiki' and hence, shows '123.atlassian.net*/wiki/space/SPACEKEY/page/TEST'.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results:

The URL should be correct i.e. base URL should not be appended in the field 'URL'.
h3. Actual Results:

The base-URL appends with the original URL and hence, it shows it twice (a dead link).
h3. Workaround

Change the site URL that doesn't consist of 'wiki' in it.
fields.summary: 'Live Search', 'Recently Updated' and ''Recently Updated Dashboard' Macro doesn't work well if the site name starts with 'wiki'

{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an app with a dynamic content macro.

 # Create a page in the legacy editor.

 # Add the macro to the page.

 # Add the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics macro to the page.

h3. Expected Results

The macro works. 
h3. Actual Results

The whole page content is wrapped with an iframe that comes from the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics macro:

 
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Adding the  Two Dimensional Filter Statistics macro breaks macros from other apps
